Ahh i thought i had to escape it somehow

answers.body:
You can omit the outer non capture group and exclude matching the parenthesis in the first character class

[^A-Za-z0-9()]+([A-Za-z0-9]+)

Regex demo

Note that the negated character class can also only match spaces and does not guarantee a non whitespace char other than a word char, so it could also match 40 in 30 40

You might also use another character class specifying the characters that should be between the first and the second part.

\w+\s*[/"]+\s*(\w+)

Regex demo

title: How to match a value UNLESS its capsulated within ()
body:
I got a solution to match the second part of a string, however i have have recently got an issue My presumptions have been to see values such as:

XS
XS / S
30/30
30"/32"

However i have recently started to see values such as 40 (XS) and have been annoyed that i grab "XS" although i really wanted my regex to skip it, if the value is incapsulated in ()

My current regex:

(?:[^A-Za-z0-9]+([A-Za-z0-9]+))

Hope someone can help me avoid matching on these so i get proper data
